financial_health.title: Financial health score
financial_health.recommendation_reduce_dti: Consider reducing your debt or increasing your income to improve your debt-to-income ratio.
financial_health.recommendation_emergency_fund: Build up your emergency fund to cover at least 3 months of expenses.
financial_health.recommendation_housing_cost: Your housing costs are high relative to your income. Consider ways to reduce housing expenses.
financial_health.recommendation_discretionary_income: Your discretionary income is low. Look for ways to reduce fixed expenses.

tooltips.debt_to_income: Debt-to-income ratio = Total loan amount / Annual gross income (before tax). Shows how much of your yearly gross income would be needed to pay off your total debt. Lower is better.
tooltips.emergency_fund: Emergency fund coverage = Emergency fund / Monthly expenses. Shows how many months of expenses your emergency fund covers. 300% means you have enough for 3 months. Aim for at least 300%.
tooltips.housing_cost: Housing cost ratio = Housing expenses / Net income. Shows what percent of your income goes to housing. Aim for less than 30%.
tooltips.discretionary_income: Discretionary Income Ratio = (Net Income - Expenses) / Net Income. Shows what percent of your income is left after all expenses.
tooltips.overall_score: The overall score summarizes your financial health from 0 (poor) to 100 (excellent). Above 80 is strong, 60-79 is fair, below 60 needs improvement. Use the tips below to improve your score.

financial_health.current_buffer_aria: How much do you have in your buffer account right now?

hushallskalkyl.title: Household budget & calculator
hushallskalkyl.intro: Creating a household budget is one of the smartest steps you can take to gain control of your finances. With a clear overview of your income and expenses, it's easier to reach your goals—whether you're saving for a trip, building an emergency fund, or making your money last each month. Budgetkollen is here to help you get started easily.

page.hero_title: Household Budget & Calculator - Take control of your finances
page.hero_subtitle: Create your personal household budget with Sweden's most useful budget calculator. Free tool to plan your family's finances and savings goals.
page.faq_title: Frequently Asked Questions about Household Budget

faq.question: What's the difference between a household calculator and household budget?
faq.answer: A household calculator helps you calculate specific financial scenarios, while a household budget is an overall plan for your income and expenses over time.

faq.question: How often should I update my household budget?
faq.answer: We recommend reviewing your household budget monthly and making major adjustments quarterly or when your financial situation changes.

faq.question: What should I include in my family budget?
faq.answer: Your family budget should include all income, fixed expenses like rent and loans, variable expenses like food and transport, plus savings and emergency fund.

tips: Set clear savings goals – both short and long term.
Create a realistic overview of all income and expenses.
Prioritize an emergency fund for unexpected costs.
Compare prices and negotiate subscriptions and insurance.
Avoid impulse purchases – wait 24 hours before big buys.
mistakes: Underestimating small expenses – they add up over time.
Not budgeting for fun and unexpected costs.
Forgetting annual fees and occasional purchases.
Not reviewing and adjusting your budget regularly.
facts: Did you know Swedes save an average of 10% of their income?
Experts recommend an emergency fund of three months' salary.
Food is often the second largest household expense after housing.
Cooking at home can save a family over 1,000 SEK/month.

faq.question: What is a household budget?
faq.answer: A household budget helps you get an overview of your income and expenses, so you can plan your finances smarter.

faq.question: Why is a household budget important?
faq.answer: With a household budget, you can avoid unexpected expenses and save for your goals.

faq.question: How often should I review my budget?
faq.answer: At least once per quarter, or whenever your financial situation changes.

faq.question: How much should I save each month?
faq.answer: Aim for at least 10% of your income, but any saving is good.

hushallskalkyl.cta_text: Ready to take control of your finances? Try Budgetkollen for free and create your own household budget today!

q1.question: What is a household budget?
q1.answer: A household budget is a plan for how the family should use their money each month. It includes all income and expenses to give a complete picture of the family's finances.

q2.question: How much should I save each month?
q2.answer: Experts recommend saving at least 20% of your monthly income. But start with what you can - even 5-10% is good to get started with saving.

q3.question: What's the difference between family budget and household budget?
q3.answer: The terms are often used synonymously. A household budget includes everyone living in the home, while a family budget focuses on the nuclear family. Both help you plan your finances.

q4.question: How often should I update my household budget?
q4.answer: Update your household budget monthly for best results. Make major changes quarterly or when your financial situation changes significantly.

schema.app_description: Compound interest calculator to calculate compound interest. Make your compound interest calculation easy. See how the compound interest effect makes your money grow exponentially.

intro.title: The magic of compound interest
intro.description: Compound interest is often called the eighth wonder of the world. When you invest money, you earn returns not just on your original investment, but also on all the returns you've accumulated over time. This creates a snowball effect that can dramatically increase your wealth over the long term.
intro.einstein_quote: Compound interest is the eighth wonder of the world. He who understands it, earns it; he who doesn't, pays it.
intro.why_important: The key to maximizing compound interest is time and consistency. Starting early and investing regularly, even small amounts, can lead to substantial wealth accumulation. This calculator helps you visualize exactly how your money can grow through the power of compounding.
intro.connection_to_budget: After creating your household budget with Budgetkollen, you can use this compound interest calculator to see how your monthly savings surplus can grow into significant wealth over time.

wonder_section.title: The Eighth Wonder of the World
wonder_section.description: Compound interest is one of the most powerful financial concepts that can help you build long-term wealth. When you save regularly and let your returns grow over time, you create a snowball effect where your money works for you.
wonder_section.einstein_quote: Compound interest is the eighth wonder of the world. He who understands it, earns it - he who doesn't, pays it.
wonder_section.understanding_text: By understanding and leveraging compound interest, you can transform small monthly amounts into significant wealth over time. Our tool helps you visualize this powerful effect.
wonder_section.budget_connection: Combine this savings calculator with our household budget to find more money to save each month.

tips_section.title: Tips for Better Saving
tips_section.tip1: Start early - time is your best friend when it comes to compound interest
tips_section.tip2: Save regularly - even small monthly amounts make a big difference
tips_section.tip3: Increase savings annually - grow with salary increases to accelerate growth
tips_section.tip4: Choose the right investment - 7% annual return is realistic for broad index funds
tips_section.tip5: Avoid touching savings - let it grow undisturbed for maximum effect
tips_section.tip6: Automate savings - make it easy with automatic transfers

q1.question: What is compound interest?
q1.answer: Compound interest means you earn returns not only on your original capital, but also on previous years' returns. This creates exponential growth over time.

q2.question: How much can I earn with compound interest?
q2.answer: It depends on starting capital, monthly savings, returns, and time. With 7% annual returns, 1000 SEK per month can grow to over 1 million SEK in 25 years.

q3.question: Is the calculator free to use?
q3.answer: Yes, our compound interest calculator is completely free to use. No registrations or downloads required.

disclaimer_section.title: Important Information
disclaimer_section.text: This calculator is for illustrative purposes only. Actual returns may vary depending on market conditions. All investments involve risk and you may lose money. Always consult a financial advisor for personal advice.

cta_section.title: Ready to optimize your finances?
cta_section.description: Use our household budget to find more money to save each month.

tips.title: Smart investment tips
tips.tip1: Start investing as early as possible - time is your greatest asset
tips.tip2: Invest regularly and consistently, regardless of market conditions
tips.tip3: Diversify your investments to reduce risk
tips.tip4: Keep your investment costs low to maximize returns
tips.tip5: Stay invested for the long term - don't panic during market downturns
tips.tip6: Reinvest all dividends and returns to maximize compounding

disclaimer.title: Important disclaimer
disclaimer.text: This calculator provides estimates based on the inputs you provide. Actual investment returns can vary significantly and past performance does not guarantee future results. Always consult with a financial advisor before making investment decisions.

cta.title: Ready to start building wealth?

q1.question: How do I calculate compound interest?
q1.answer: Use our compound interest calculator above. Enter starting capital, monthly savings, expected return and time period. The calculator automatically performs your compound interest calculation and shows how your money grows.

q2.question: What is compound interest calculation?
q2.answer: A compound interest calculation computes how your investment grows when you earn returns on both your original capital and previously earned interest. This creates exponential growth over time.

q3.question: How do I use a compound interest calculator?
q3.answer: Our compound interest calculator is easy to use. Fill in your starting amount, how much you want to save each month, expected annual return and number of years. Then click 'Calculate' to see the result.
